main event: An unidentified flying object of approximately 6 feet long and 4 feet wide with a golden appearance in the center surrounded by a blue reflection was observed by witnesses driving south of Statesville, N.C. It seemed to be rotating in slow turns and intermittently disappeared and reappeared.
interesting points: The object was initially mistaken for a falling plane by the observer.
The observers were described as having poor reputations, but the Chief of Police ultimately believed that they actually saw something.
A similar described object was seen by multiple individuals in the vicinity of Hickory and Salisbury, N.C.
The mysterious blue ball of light appeared over the North Carolina countryside, scaring those who saw it, and one motorist reported it 'chasing' his car for several miles.
Weather Bureau officials initially explained the sighting as possibly a weather balloon, but the report by the car dealer occurred two hours before the weather balloon was launched.
photographs: The report does not contain any photographs
